description: This source file implements system state sampling for a build system, capturing memory info, disk stats, CPU stats, and disk usage events. It defines a class SystemStats responsible for collecting, processing, and writing system metrics, and interacts with build-specific variables and events.

classes.name: SystemStats
classes.description: Main class for sampling and managing system state information such as memory, disk, CPU, and disk usage data from /proc files and events.

methods.name: __init__(self, d)
methods.description: Constructor that initializes system stats gathering, sets up directories, regex patterns, and prepares file handles for data collection.

methods.name: close(self)
methods.description: Closes open file handles used for logging system stats.

methods.name: _reduce_meminfo(self, time, data)
methods.description: Parses memory info data to extract MemTotal, MemFree, Buffers, Cached, SwapTotal, SwapFree and returns formatted data.

methods.name: _diskstats_is_relevant_line(self, linetokens)
methods.description: Filters and determines if a line from diskstats corresponds to relevant disks based on regex matching.

methods.name: _reduce_diskstats(self, time, data)
methods.description: Processes /proc/diskstats data to aggregate read/write sectors and utilization, and computes throughput and utilization metrics.

methods.name: _reduce_nop(self, time, data)
methods.description: A no-operation reduction method that returns the input data unprocessed.

methods.name: _reduce_stat(self, time, data)
methods.description: Parses CPU statistics from /proc/stat and computes CPU load metrics over time.

methods.name: sample(self, event, force)
methods.description: Triggers sampling of system data, reading from /proc files and processing disk events, writing summarized data to log files.
